. It is the largest sea park in Southern Africa

The park was created in order to protect dugong and marine turtles and their respective habitats. Due to their significance the vegetation of the islands, the coral reefs, marine birds and the fauna of the park were also included.

Situated in the Inhambane province on and along the coast of Vilanculos and Inhassoro districts, the park covers a large expanse of ocean as well as the five islands of the archipelago with an area of 1430 km2.

Bazaruto Archipelago, comprised of five islands off the southern coast of Mozambique, is a protected conservation area of 1,430 km2. The warm  waters between the archipelago and the mainland support the last known population of dugongs in the Western Indian Ocean. Dolphins and whales are found in deeper waters and several marine turtles breed on the islands pristine beaches.===

Best time to visit March- November
Climate Tropical to sub-tropical; Hot with occasional rain and cloudy days from November to March; otherwise mainly  dry
These are normally included in the tour packages and are variable between US$10 per person  and US$13 per person depending on exchange rate  and local politics

The islands  Bazaruto, Benguerra, Magaruque, Santa Carolina and Bangue. The Archipelago is truly one of the most beautiful destinations on the African continent for more information contact "http://www.divebazaruto.com"
Scuba Diving, Snorkeling, Deep Sea fishing, Ocean Safari, Sun, Fun and relax.
